title: Kate Garraway awkwardly laughs off I'm A Celeb rumour but refuses to deny it
text:
Get the biggest I'm a Celebrity stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Kate Garraway has laughed off speculation she is heading to Australia to star on this year's I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!

The Good Morning Britain presenter got the giggles as she could neither confirm or deny she'd be joining the line-up of the Ant and Dec fronted show, that looks set to return next month.

As Kate went through the newspapers on Monday's edition of GMB, her co-host Ben Shephard quizzed her on rumours that have been circulating.

"How much of this can we believe Kate Garraway?" he asked.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

"The jungle?" pressed Ben, as Kate continued to feign ignorance.

"Yes, I can confirm it's a show on ITV," laughed Kate.

"I read that Darcey and Billy (Kate's two children) are really keen for you to go in," teased Ben.

"Actually, that bit I can confirm is true. They'd love me to do it," said Kate.

Ben and Charlotte Hawkins agreed they'd also love to see Kate attempt the reality show.

(Image: ITV)

Kate,52, then got serious for a moment as she broke down the rules of taking part.

"Even if I was doing it I couldn't say I was doing it. And if you're not doing it you can't say you're not doing it," she explained.

When a guest pointed out Kate must have had a conversation ITV if she knew the regulations, she laughed again and replied: "I don't know about that?

"I don't like heights. I don't like the dark. I don't like camping," she protested.

Ben Shepherd then joked Kate is far too messy to live with a bunch of celebs in an outdoor camp.

(Image: ITV)

It was reported over the weekend that Kate would be joining the I'm A Celebrity line-up.

The rumour mill started churning as Kate has allegedly booked a chunk of time off work to coincide with the upcoming series.

Kate was linked to the show last year but sources said she was forced to pull out due to her hectic schedule.

A stint Down Under wouldn't be Kate's first try at reality TV.

She appeared on the fifth series of Strictly Come Dancing in 2007 where she was partnered with Anton Du Beke.
description: The GMB host was reported to have signed up for the show after clearing her schedule over the coming weeks
